sections.heading: Bouldin Creek Homes
sections.content:
Bouldin or Bouldin Creek is home to the famous mural "Greeting from Austin". The neighborhood is one of the oldest in Austin with few of its structures were built from the 1920s still stand. Homes in Bouldin Creek ranges from homes that were built in the 1920s and '30s which are also historic, single-family homes, and newly constructed ones that provide a modern vibe. Single-family homes are relatively smaller that includes 2-4 bedrooms and with a size of 800-3,000 square feet. Home prices can range from just below $300,000 to well over $1 million.

Aside from homes, there are also condos in Bouldin Creek that are great for single and small families. Living in the area offers a suburban feel. There are 58% of residents that are renting in the area while there are 42% of residents that own their homes.

sections.heading: Bouldin Creek Austin Condos
sections.content:
The Bouldin Creek neighborhood has a wide array of condos perfect for small families, singles, young professionals, and empty nesters. Here are some Bouldin Creek Condos:

### The 5th
A multi-story modern industrial style condo located within Bouldin. Residents enjoy the proximity to shops, dining, green spaces, and [Downtown Austin](/communities/downtown-austin). Since 2015, there are six condos within the complex that offers gorgeous landscapes, a rooftop deck, and upper floor views of the city. Most units have two-bedrooms with attached garages.

### 2020 Congress Condos
2020 Congress Condos in a community located within the Bouldin Creek neighborhood which is just 2 miles away from Downtown Austin. 2020 Congress Condos is within walking distance of restaurants, boutiques, and music venues within South Congress. 2020 Congress holds 2 acres of land with a total of 103 units within the 9 buildings. Residents enjoy wide-array amenities such as a community fitness center and swimming pool.

### J Bouldin Residences
A unique Bouldin Creek modern condo in the heart of South Austin nestled among heritage oaks. J Bouldin Residences has 34 unites in four distinct floor plans with two to three-bedroom multi-level townhomes and one to two-bedroom flats. Residents enjoy the stunning skyline views on the rooftop deck and a dog park for their fur friends to play.

### 04 Lofts
04 Lofts in one of the Bouldin Creek Condos situated off SoCo with 28 units. Experience a unique creative living space close to retail stores, restaurants, and offices. Minimal amenities keep HOA fees low although residents get to witness magnificent city views from their units or on the rooftop terrace.

sections.heading: Where is Bouldin Creek Located?
sections.content:
Bouldin Creek is located across the river from Downtown Austin. The neighborhood is accessible via the bridges on South 1st Street and South Congress Avenue. It is bounded by Town lake and Downtown Austin to the north, Oltorf Street on the south. While South Congress Avenue is located to its east and the Union Pacific railroad tracking near South Lamar Boulevard to the west.

Within the neighboring boundaries of Bouldin Creek Austin, there are also different parks you can visit and outdoor activities you can do. In just a few minutes away, you will be able to take a dip at Barton Springs Pool, jog, or picnic at [Zilker](/communities/zilker) park or take your dog for a walk at the Town Lake Metropolitan Park. If you are looking into enjoying the waterscapes nearby, kayaks and canoes are available in the area.

sections.heading: Bouldin Creek Things to Do
sections.content:
Bouldin Creek is one of the most walkable neighborhoods in Austin. It has a walk score of 81/100 and a bike score of 78/100 with most errands can be accomplished on foot. With over 250 restaurants, coffee shops, and bars in the area, people are able to walk to their local shops within an average of 6 minutes.

Bouldin Creek neighborhood is one of the best locations for people that love the walkability and convenience of downtown Austin but want to live in a home. The restaurants that make up this area include Bouldin Creek Cafe, Fresa's Chicken, Sway, Lenoir, and Elizabeth Street Cafe. And if that's not enough, you're adjacent to the South Congress (SoCo) entertainment district to the east and the South Lamar (SoLa) entertainment district to the west, both of which offer a wide assortment of funky stores, cafes, coffee shops, and restaurants.

From the standpoint of being walkable, this is one of the best Austin neighborhoods and many urbanists believe it is the pinnacle of Austin living. Bouldin Creek is a quirky, hip, and unique neighborhood known for its major festivals such as the SXSW and being the cultural center of South Austin.

sections.heading: Bouldin Creek Schools
sections.content:
Becker Elementary and Travis Heights Elementary (PK-5) both provide dual-language programs. Fulmore Middle School (6-8) and William B. Travis High School (9-12) also serve the community. The neighborhood's largest institutional resident is the 65-acre Texas School for the Deaf. As with all neighborhoods served by AISD, there are other magnet school options for residents.

**Becker Elementary School**
906 W. Milton St., Austin, TX 78704
Phone: (512) 414-2019

Located in the heart of the Bouldin Creek neighborhood in South Austin, Becker offers outstanding programs and a vibrant community that has attracted numerous families to transfer within the area throughout Austin.

**Travis Heights Elementary School**
2010 Alameda Drive, Austin, TX 78704
Phone: (512) 414-4495

Established in 1939, Travis Heights Elementary School is a community build on collaboration among students, teachers, families, and partners.

**Lively Middle School**
201 E. Mary St.
Austin, TX 78704
Phone: (512) 414-3207

Lively Middle School is located on SoCo Avenue and down the street from Texas Capitol. Lively Humanities and Law Magnet for International Students offers advanced academic programming.

**Travis Heights High School**
1211 E. Oltorf St., Austin, TX 78704
Phone: (512) 414-2527

Travis Early College High School has a rich history of serving students in South Austin since it opened in 1953. Travis Heights High School has diverse academic offerings, strong athletics, and fine arts programs.
